metadata.title: CVE-2015-7801 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in OptiPNG 0.6.4 allows remote attackers toexecute arbitrary code via a crafted PNG file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7801` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

optipng - 0.6.4-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: optipng package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.6.4-1ubuntu0.14.04.1').
